head.title: The Quackatorium and Other Web Troves

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Technology, Telecommunications and Internet

hedline.hl1: The Quackatorium and Other Web Troves

abstract.p: New Web site Museumspot.com guides users to traditional art museums, zoos and other points of interest; photo (S)

block.p: Whether your tastes run to medieval illuminated manuscripts or to wax figures of George Burns, Museumspot.com can help you track down museums full of treasures (www.museum spot.com).
Whether your tastes run to medieval illuminated manuscripts or to wax figures of George Burns, Museumspot.com can help you track down museums full of treasures (www.museum spot.com).

The site, which is a collection of traditional art museums as well as war monuments, virtual collections, aquariums, halls of fame, botanical gardens and zoos, includes basic information, museum links and other online directories. Among the more unusual entries are the Quackatorium, a site devoted to antique medical devices; the Burlingame Museum of Pez Memorabilia in Burlingame, Calif.; and the Bata Shoe Museum in Toronto.
Browser A selection of events and sites on the Web.
TODAY, 11:15 a.m. chat.yahoo.com Webcast of a documentary about Paul McCartney's turn to canvas and paintbrush, followed at noon by a chat with Mr. McCartney.
FRIDAY, 2 p.m. www.bn.com Chat with J. K. Rowling, author of the Harry Potter series.
TUESDAY, 9 p.m. www.myprimetime.com Chat with Ann Bancroft and Liv Arnesen, who will try to cross Antarctica on skis this fall, an expedition that they expect will take more than three months.

www.refdesk.com A collection of links to all sorts of facts, figures and reference materials, including several words-of-the-day, campaign sites, pictures, newspapers and online dictionaries. and other reference books.
www.last-word.com How do fish get into high mountain lakes? Why does a boomerang come back? Find the answers to these questions and many more, at the Q & A page of New Science magazine's Web site.

www.roadtripamerica.com A couple's online journal of their permanent road trip in a high-tech home on wheels, with stories about people across the United States, places to eat and photographs of unusual signs and dogs befriended by Marvin the Road Dog.
